title: Ticket #1655: Shadow exits due to dprintf rotation failure
description:
A shadow running 7.4.3 exited unexpectedly on the ChemE glow cluster with the following error:

$ cat dprintf_failure.SHADOW dprintf() had a fatal error in pid 28488 rename(/var/log/condor/ShadowLog) succeeded but file still exists!euid: 101, ruid: 0

LOG is on a ext3 file system, so I'm not sure how this can happen.
remarks:
2010-Sep-15 10:00:58 by cweiss:
I knew I know this puppy. This is the same issue as #1484. Already fixed in 7.4.4

2010-Sep-15 11:18:19 by cweiss:
After a discussion with Greg, I put together a quick survey on when _condor_dprintf_exit is called. We should think carefully about whether those exits are really all necessary or whether we should deal with those cases more conservatively and just print a warning about it happening.

  • printf fails
  • DebugLock cannot be opened (should we fall back on printing w/o lock + sending an admin email?)
  • Cannot get exclusive lock (-- "" --)
  • Cannot open DebugFile
  • Cannot seek to end of DebugFP
  • Cannot fflush DebugFP
  • Cannot release exclusive lock
  • Cannot fclose DebugFP
  • Rename failed
  • Rename succeeded but file still exists
  • DebugFP open for specific debug level failed
check_ins: 2010-Sep-15 16:07   Check-in [18988]: Remove a _condor_dprintf_exit call after dprintf finds the original log file to be there after a rename. It's something that should be reported but not lead to a hard exit. This relates to issue #1484 (or #1655). (By Cathrin Weiss )
